messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a world with 16 rooms. Room 1 is connected to rooms 2, 3, 4, and 7. Room 2 is connected to rooms 1, 3, 4, and 16. Room 3 is connected to rooms 1, 2, 4 and 5. Room 4 is also connected to rooms 1, 2, 3, and 14. Room 5 is connected to rooms 6, 7, 8, and 3. Room 6 is connected to rooms 5, 7, 8, and 12. Room 7 is connected to rooms 1, 8, 6, and 5. Room 8 is also connected to rooms 5, 6, 7, and 10. Room 9 is connected to rooms 10, 11,12, and 15. Room 10 is connected to rooms 9, 11, 8, and 12. Room 11 is connected to rooms 13, 9, 12, and 10. Room 12 is also connected to rooms 9, 10, 11, and 6. Room 13 is connected to rooms 14, 15, 16, and 11. Room 14 is connected to rooms 4, 13, 15, 16. Room 15 is connected to rooms 13, 14, 16, and 9. Room 16 is also connected to rooms 13, 14, 15, and 2. From room 5 what is the shortest path to room 15? Starting from room 5, please list the room numbers in order, including 5, separated by commas.

To find the shortest path from room 5 to room 15, we can use Dijkstra's algorithm. Here are the steps:

1. Create a table with all the rooms and their distances from room 5. Initially, set the distance of room 5 to 0 and all other distances to infinity.

| Room | Distance |
|------|----------|
| 1    | ∞        |
| 2    | ∞        |
| 3    | 1        |
| 4    | ∞        |
| 5    | 0        |
| 6    | 2        |
| 7    | 1        |
| 8    | 2        |
| 9    | 3        |
| 10   | 3        |
| 11   | 4        |
| 12   | 3        |
| 13   | ∞        |
| 14   | ∞        |
| 15   | ∞        |
| 16   | ∞        |

2. Mark room 5 as visited.

3. For each room connected to room 5, update its distance in the table if it is shorter than the current distance. In this case, rooms 3, 6, 7, and 8 are connected to room 5.

| Room | Distance |
|------|----------|
| 1    | ∞        |
| 2    | ∞        |
| 3    | 1        |
| 4    | ∞        |
| 5    | 0        |
| 6    | 2        |
| 7    | 1        |
| 8    | 2        |
| 9    | 3        |
| 10   | 3        |
| 11   | 4        |
| 12   | 3        |
| 13   | ∞        |
| 14   | ∞        |
| 15   | ∞        |
| 16   | ∞        |

4. Choose the room with the shortest distance that has not been visited yet. In this case, it is room 3.

5. Mark room 3 as visited.

6. For each room connected to room 3, update its distance in the table if it is shorter than the current distance. In this case, rooms 1, 2, 4, and 5 are connected to room 3.

| Room | Distance |
|------|----------|
| 1    | 2        |
| 2    | 3        |
| 3    | 1        |
| 4    | 2        |
| 5    | 1        |
| 6    | 2        |
| 7    | 1        |
| 8    | 2        |
| 9    | 3        |
| 10   | 3        |
| 11   | 4        |
| 12   | 3        |
| 13   | ∞        |
| 14   | ∞        |
| 15   | ∞        |
| 16   | ∞        |

7. Choose the room with the shortest distance that has not been visited yet. In this case, it is room 7.

8. Mark room 7 as visited.

9. For each room connected to room 7, update its distance in the table if it is shorter than the current distance. In this case, rooms 1, 5, 6, and 8 are connected to room 7.

| Room | Distance |
|------|----------|
| 1    | 2        |
| 2    | 3        |
| 3    | 1        |
| 4    | 2        |
| 5    | 1        |
| 6    | 2        |
| 7    | 1        |
| 8    | 2        |
| 9    | 3        |
| 10   | 3        |
| 11   | 4        |
| 12   | 3        |
| 13   | ∞        |
| 14   | ∞        |
| 15   | 4        |
| 16   | ∞        |

10. Choose the room with the shortest distance that has not been visited yet. In this case, it is room 5.

11. Mark room 5 as visited.

12. For each room connected to room 5, update its distance in the table if it is shorter than the current distance. In this case, rooms 3, 6, 7, and 8 are connected to room 5, but they have already been visited, so we don't need to update their distances.

| Room | Distance |
|------|----------|
| 1    | 2        |
| 2    | 3        |
| 3    | 1        |
| 4    | 2        |
| 5    | 0        |
| 6    | 2        |
| 7    | 1        |
| 8    | 2        |
| 9    | 3        |
| 10   | 3        |
| 11   | 4        |
| 12   | 3        |
| 13   | ∞        |
| 14   | ∞        |
| 15   | 4        |
| 16   | ∞        |

13. Choose the room with the shortest distance that has not been visited yet. In this case, it is room 4.

14. Mark room 4 as visited.

15. For each room connected to room 4, update its distance in the table if it is shorter than the current distance. In this case, rooms 1, 2, 3, and 14 are connected to room 4.

| Room | Distance |
|------|----------|
| 1    | 2        |
| 2    | 3        |
| 3    | 1        |
| 4    | 2        |
| 5    | 0        |
| 6    | 2        |
| 7    | 1        |
| 8    | 2        |
| 9    | 3        |
| 10   | 3        |
| 11   | 4        |
| 12   | 3        |
| 13   | ∞        |
| 14   | 3        |
| 15   | 4        |
| 16   | ∞        |

16. Choose the room with the shortest distance that has not been visited yet. In this case, it is room 15.

17. Mark room 15 as visited.

18. For each room connected to room 15, update its distance in the table if it is shorter than the current distance. In this case, rooms 9, 13, 14, and 16 are connected to room 15.

| Room | Distance |
|------|----------|
| 1    | 2        |
| 2    | 3        |
| 3    | 1        |
| 4    | 2        |
| 5    | 0        |
| 6    | 2        |
| 7    | 1        |
| 8    | 2        |
| 9    | 3        |
| 10   | 3        |
| 11   | 4        |
| 12   | 3        |
| 13   | 5        |
| 14   | 3        |
| 15   | 4        |
| 16   | 5        |

19. Choose the room with the shortest distance that has not been visited yet. In this case, it is room 9.

20. Mark room 9 as visited.

21. For each room connected to room 9, update its distance in the table if it is shorter than the current distance. In this case, rooms 10, 11, 12, and 15 are connected to room 9, but they have already been visited, so we don't need to update their distances.

| Room | Distance |
|------|----------|
| 1    | 2        |
| 2    | 3        |
| 3    | 1        |
| 4    | 2        |
| 5    | 0        |
| 6    | 2        |
| 7    | 1        |
| 8    | 2        |
| 9    | 3        |
| 10   | 3        |
| 11   | 4        |
| 12   | 3        |
| 13   | 5        |
| 14   | 3        |
| 15   | 4        |
| 16   | 5        |

22. Choose the room with the shortest distance that has not been visited yet. In this case, it is room 11.

23. Mark room 11 as visited.

24. For each room connected to room 11, update its distance in the table if it is shorter than the current distance. In this case, rooms 9, 10, 12, and 13 are connected to room 11, but they have already been visited, so we don't need to update their distances.

| Room | Distance |
|------|----------|
| 1    | 2        |
| 2    | 3        |
| 3    | 1        |
| 4    | 2        |
|
